DataElement.preferredName: Brief Pain Inventory Short Form Questionnaire 3 Last 24 Hours Pain at its Worst Score 11 Point Likert Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation rating pain at its worst in the last 24 hours, using a 11 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Brief Pain Inventory Short Form Questionnaire Last 24 Hours Pain at its Worst Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to questionnaire._A standardized survey originally developed and copyrighted by Charles S. Cleeland in 1991 which is used to evaluate the severity of a patient's pain and the impact that their pain has on their daily activities. This shorter version of the Brief Pain Inventory (BPI) is more useful for clinical trials, can be completed by the patient or in an interview format, and consists of only 9 questions most of which can be answered on a 0-10 rating scale._Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero._A unit measure of time equal to 3,600 seconds or 60 minutes. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability._A question about an individual's pain at its worst.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to questionnaire.

Property.preferredName: Brief Pain Inventory Short Form Questionnaire Last Integer Hour Pain at its Worst Score
Property.preferredDefinition: A standardized survey originally developed and copyrighted by Charles S. Cleeland in 1991 which is used to evaluate the severity of a patient's pain and the impact that their pain has on their daily activities. This shorter version of the Brief Pain Inventory (BPI) is more useful for clinical trials, can be completed by the patient or in an interview format, and consists of only 9 questions most of which can be answered on a 0-10 rating scale.:Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.:A unit measure of time equal to 3,600 seconds or 60 minutes. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day.:A question about an individual's pain at its worst.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.longName: Brief Pain Inventory Short Form Questionnaire
Concepts.definition: A standardized survey originally developed and copyrighted by Charles S. Cleeland in 1991 which is used to evaluate the severity of a patient's pain and the impact that their pain has on their daily activities. This shorter version of the Brief Pain Inventory (BPI) is more useful for clinical trials, can be completed by the patient or in an interview format, and consists of only 9 questions most of which can be answered on a 0-10 rating scale.
Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A unit measure of time equal to 3,600 seconds or 60 minutes. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day.
A question about an individual's pain at its worst.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

ValueDomain.preferredName: BPI Pain Rating Score 11 Point Likert Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard for the subjective scoring of pain that ranges from 0: No Pain to 10: Pain As Bad As You Can Imagine.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDISC Aligned NCI Standard Equivalent CDE
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is to be used for CDISC aligned data collection in place of CDE 4683032 from the original NCI Standard CRF Template.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDISC Questionnaire BPI Short Form Test Code Terminology
ReferenceDocuments.description: Test codes of questionnaire questions associated with the short-form brief pain inventory for the Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium (CDISC) Standard Data Tabulation Model (SDTM).

ReferenceDocuments.name: Please rate your pain by circ
ReferenceDocuments.description: Please rate your pain by circling the one number that best describes your pain at its WORST in the last 24 hours.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex-1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Please rate your pain by selecting the one number that best describes your pain at its WORST in the past 24 hours.
